msItem.title: A Catena Patrum, or Selections from the writings of the Fathers, forming a commentary on a great part of the Old and New Testaments.
msItem.note: The Biblical books are taken in the following order.

msItem.title: 1. The Pentateuch
msItem.note: The commentary consists chiefly of excerpts from the Glaphyra of Cyril of Alexandria and his treatise "de Adoratione in Spiritu," which are expressly mentioned on foll. 5 b, ܫܠܡ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܒܪܝܬܐ: ܐ̇ܬܦܫܩ ܐܝܟ ܕܒܦܣܝ̈ܩܬܐ ܡܢ ܓܠܝܦܪܐ, 19 a, 29 a. His commentary on the Gospel of S. Luke is cited on fol. 7 b. The other authorities named are: Ephraim, foll. 17 b, 24 a; Gregory Nazianzen, ܡܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܬܐܘܠܘܓܝܐ, fol. 23 a; Severus of Antioch, hom. epithron. iv., fol. 28 b, xvi., fol. 29 b, lvi., fol. 23 b, lxxix., fol. 23 b, lxxxiv., fol. 24 a, exxiv., fol. 28 b; ܡܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܩ̇ ܬܘ̈ܣ ܕܝܘܠܝܢܐ, fol. 12 a; ܡܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܐ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܠܕܝܩܝܐ., fol. 11 a; ܡܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܐܢܛܪܝܟܘܣ ܐܦܝܣ ܕܐܢܙܪܒܐ., fol. 29 a.

msItem.author: Cyril of Alexandria
msItem.title: Excerpts from the Glaphyra and the treatise "de Adoratione in Spiritu"
msItem.quote: ܫܠܡ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܒܪܝܬܐ: ܐ̇ܬܦܫܩ ܐܝܟ ܕܒܦܣܝ̈ܩܬܐ ܡܢ ܓܠܝܦܪܐ
msItem.note: Cyril of Alexandria's commentary on the Gospel of S. Luke is also cited on fol. 7 b.

msItem.title: 2. The book of Job
msItem.note: The authorities cited by name are: Chrysostom, on the Pauline Epistles, foll. 31 b, 32 b, 33 b; on Ps. xl., fol. 31 b; comment, on Job, fol. 34 a; Ephraim, fol. 34 b; Olympiodorus, ܐܠܘܡܦܝܕܘܪܘܣ, deacon of Alexandria, comment. on Job, foll. 33 a and b, 34 a; Severus, ܡܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܐܢܣܛܣܝܐ ܡܫܡܫܢܝܬܐ, fol. 34 b.

msItem.title: Five sections constitute the appendix, showing why God permits holy men to be tried in this world; why he does not grant to them to be independent of others; that to flee from persecutors is not deserving of blame; etc.
msItem.rubric: ܕܡܛܠ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܥ̈ܠܠܬܐ ܫ̇ܒܩ ܐܠܗܐ ܠܐ̈ܢܫܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ̇. ܕܢܥܠܘܢ ܠܢܣܝ̈ܘܢܐ ܒܥܠܡܐ ܗܢܐ܀ ܕܡܛܠ ܡܢܐ ܠܐ ܝܗܒ̣ ܐܠܗܐ ܠܐܢܫܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ̇. ܕܢܗܘܘܢ ܣ̈ܦܩܝ ܢ ܠܢܦܫܗܘ܀ ܥܠ ܕܠܐ ܥ̇ܕܝܠܝܢ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܥܪܩܝܢ ܡܢ ܩܕܡ ܪ̈ܕܘܦܐ܀ ܥܠ ܕܠܘ ܟܠܡܕܡ ܕܫܐ̇ܠܝܢ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܒܨܠܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ̇. ܡܚܕܐ ܝܗ̇ܒ ܠܗܘܢ̇. ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܫܐ̇ܠܝܢ ܡܢܗ܀ ܥܠ ܕܥܝ̇ܕܐ ܗܘ ܠܡ̈ܠܦܢܐ: ܕܟܕ ܚܕ ܡܣܟܠ̣. ܕܓܘܐ ܢܥܒܕܘܢܗ̇ ܠܡܪܫܘܬܐ.
msItem.note: It contains extracts from Chrysostom, foll. 35 a and 36 a (comment, on 2 Corinthians).

msItem.title: 3. The book of Judges
msItem.note: The following tracts are interposed.

msItem.title: a. On the versions of the Scriptures
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܫܘܘܕܥܐ ܕܣܓ̇ܝ ܚ̇ܫܚ ܡܛܠ ܡ̈ܫܠܡܢܘܬܐ ܡ̈ܫܚܠܦܬܐ ܕܟܬ̈ܒܐ ܐܠܗ̈ܝܐ̣. ܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܐ̇ܬܦܫܩܘ ܡܢ ܠܫܢܐ ܥܒܪܝܐ ܠܝܘܢܝܐ
msItem.note: It briefly treats the following texts.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Of the Hexapla of Origen, and the critical marks which he employed
msItem.rubric: ܐܘܪܓܢܝܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܦ ܐܕܡܢܛܘܣ ܐܬܩܪܝ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܗܘܐ ܒܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܥܢܘܝܐ

msItem.title: An extract on the same subject from the treatise of Epiphanius on Weights and Measures closes the section
msItem.rubric: ܫܘܘܕܥܐ ܐܚܪܢܐ ܕܡܟ̣ܢܫ ܐܝܟ ܕܒܦܣ̈ܝܩܬܐ̣. ܡܢ ܫܪܒܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒܝܕ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܦܝܦܢܝܘܣ ܡܛܠ ܐܣܛܪ̈ܝܣܩܘ ܘܒܐ̈ܠܘ܇ (sic) ܘܠܝܡ̈ܢܝܣܩܘ ܘܗ̈ܘܦܘ ܠܝܡ̈ܢܝܣܩܘ܇ ܕܡܫܬܟܚܝܢ ܕܪܫܝܡܝܢ ܒܟ̈ܬܒܐ ܩܕ̈ܝܫܐ.

msItem.title: b. On the canonical books of the Old and New Testaments
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܟܡܐ̣ ܘܐܝܠܝܢ ܐܢܘܢ ܟܬ̈ܒܐ ܕܡܩܒܠܐ ܥܕܬܐ

msItem.title: The section comprises an extract from the 39th festal letter of Athanasius (see Cureton’s Festal Letters of Athanasius, p. ܢܒ), the 81st canon of the Apostles, and an extract from Chrysostom on Ps. xl.
4. The four books of Kings
msItem.note: The writers quoted by name are:

msItem.author: Cyril
msItem.title: Cyril
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܫܬܐ̣. ܕܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܬܫܡܫܬܐ ܕܒܪܘܚ

msItem.title: 5. The two books of Chronicles, according to the LXX
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܚܣܝܪ̈ܬܐ̣. ܐܝܟ ܡܫܠܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܫܒܥܝܢ
msItem.note: At the end are some extracts from Severus.

msItem.author: Severus
msItem.title: Extracts illustrating passages in the books of Kings and Chronicles
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܛܠ ܗܢܘܢ ܡ̈ܫܚܝ ܡܢܕܪܝܫ

msItem.title: 6. The first and second books of Ezra, according to the LXX
msItem.note: From the words ܡ̈ܠܟܐ ܕܦܪܣܝܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܝܒܠܝܢ ܘܪܕܝܢ ܡܢ ܐܪܕܫܝܪ ܒܪ ܣܣܢ ܘܠܟܐ̣. ܫܪܝܘ ܡܢ ܫܢܬ ܫܡܫܡܐܐ ܘܬܠܬܝܢ ܘܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘ., it would appear that the compiler of this work lived in the first half of the viith cent., for he wrote before the death of Yezdijird, the last of the Sāsānides, who perished A.D. 651, and he uses the translation of the LXX. by Paul of Tellā, which was made A. Gr. 928, A.D. 617 (see fol. 161 b).

msItem.title: A short section showing that prayer is of avail in time of war, as proved by the examples of Moses, Joshua, Samuel, David, Hezekiah, and Asa.
7. Select passages from the books of Proverbs and Ecclesiasticus
msItem.rubric: ܦܬܓ̈ܡܐ ܡ̈ܓܒܝܐ: ܐܝܟ ܕܠܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ̣. ܡܢ ܡ̈ܬܠܐ ܕܫܠܝܡܘܢ̣. ܘܕܚܟܝܡܐ ܒܪܣܝܪܟ
msItem.note: Select passages from the writings of the Fathers, ܡ̈ܠܐ ܕܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ, follow.

msItem.author: Chrysostom
msItem.title: Chrysostom, hom. Ix. on S. John's Gospel

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Passages from Ephraim
msItem.note: There is another extract on 71a.

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.note: There is another extract on 71a.

msItem.author: Athanasius
msItem.title: 8. The Psalms, with an abridgment of the commentary of Athanasius
msItem.rubric: ܟܘܢܫܐ ܐܝܟ ܕܒܦܣܝ̈ܩܬܐ ܡܢ ܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܡ̈ܙܡܘܪܐ̣. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܒܝܕ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܬܢܣܝܘܗ. ܕܡܘܕܥ ܐܝܟ ܕܒܩܦܠܐܘܢ ܚܝܠܐ ܕܟܠܚܕ ܡܢ ܡܙܡܘܪ̈ܐ ܘܡ̇ܢܗܪ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܥܡܘܛܐܝܬ ܐܡܝܪ̈ܢ ܒܗܘܢ.

msItem.title: There is a short section on the authors of the Psalms at the end
msItem.incipit: ܒܪܡ ܙ̇ܕܩ ܐܦ ܗܕܐ ܠܡܕܥ̣. ܕܠܘ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܡܙܡܘܪ̈ܐ ܕܕܘܝܕ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Basil
msItem.title: Basil is cited
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܡ ܕܥܠ ܫܘܪܝ ܡ̈ܬܠܘܗܝ ܕܫܠܝܡܘܢ
ܡܢ ܡ ܕܥܠ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐ̇ܬܒܩܐ ܒܩܢܘܡܟ

msItem.author: Olympiodorus, deacon of Alexandria
msItem.title: 10. The book of Ecclesiastes, with extracts from the commentary of Olympiodorus, deacon of Alexandria

msItem.author: Gregory Nyssen
msItem.title: Extracts from the commentaries of Gregory Nyssen

msItem.author: Symmachus
msItem.title: Extracts from the commentaries of Symmachus
12. The book of Wisdom

msItem.author: John bar Aphtūnāyā, abbat of Kinnesrīn
Gregory Nyssen
msItem.title: Extracts from the commentaries on the Song of Songs by John (bar Aphtūnāyā), abbat of Kinnesrīn and Gregory Nyssen
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., p. 54.

msItem.author: Severus
msItem.title: An extract from a letter of Severus to the Church at Antioch
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܐܪܬܕܘܟܣܘ ܕܒܐܢܛܝܟܝܐ

msItem.title: On the seasons of the year

msItem.note: As an introduction to the prophetical books, we find a short extract from the treatise of Epiphanius on Weights and Measures, sect. i. Fol. 139 a.

msItem.title: 13. The twelve minor Prophets
msItem.note: The following fathers are cited.

msItem.author: Gregory Nyssen
msItem.title: Gregory Nyssen is cited
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܣܘܡܦܠܝܩܘܣ ܕܡܛܠ ܐܒܐ ܘܒܪܐ ܘܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ.

msItem.author: Jeremiah
msItem.title: 14. Jeremiah
msItem.note: The following authors are cited.

msItem.author: Daniel
msItem.title: 16. Daniel
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܕܢܝܐܝܠ ܢܒܝܐ̇. ܕܐܬ̇ܦܫܩ ܡܢ ܡܫܠܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܫܒܥܝܢ ܘܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܡ̈ܦܫܩܢܐ̇. ܕܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܦܛܘܠܡܐܘܣ ܡ̇ܠܟܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ ܩܕܡ ܡܐܬܝܬܐ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ̣ ܫ̈ܢܝܐ ܡܐܐ ܝܬܝܪ ܚܣܝܪ̈. ܦܫܩܘ ܠܟܬ̈ܒܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܡܢ ܠܫܢܐ ܥܒܪܝܐ ܠܝܘܢܝܐ ܒܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ ܪܒܬܐ. ܗ̇ܝ ܕܒܗ̇ ܘܐܦ ܡܢ ܠܫܢܐ ܝܘܢܝܐ ܠܣܘܪܝܝܐ ܐ̇ܬܦܫܩܘ: ܡܢ ܚܣܝܐ ܡܪܝ ܦܘܠܐ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܡܗ̈ܝܡܢܐ̣. ܫܢܬ ܬܫܥܡܐܐ ܘܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܘܬܡܢܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ ܗܢܕܩܛܝܘܢܐ̣ ܕܦܡܛܐ.
msItem.note: The rubric at the end of this book gives the dates of the Septuagint version and of the Syriac translation of Paul of Tellā.
The following are cited.

msItem.author: Chrysostom
msItem.title: Chrysostom is cited
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܡ ܕܥܠ ܨܘܡܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܕܢܝܐܝܠ

msItem.author: Isaiah
msItem.title: 17. Isaiah
msItem.note: The following are cited.

msItem.author: S. Paul
John Chrysostom
msItem.title: 18. The Epistles of S. Paul, with extracts from the commentary of John Chrysostom, in the following order: Romans, 1 and 2 Corinthians, Galatians, Ephesians, Philippians, 1 and 2 Thessalonians, 1 and 2 Timothy, Titus, Colossians, and Hebrews
msItem.note: The following are cited on the margin.

msItem.author: Chrysostom
msItem.title: Chrysostom is cited
msItem.rubric: ܡܢ ܡ ܕܥܠ ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ. ܕܪܫܗ ܒܝܕܥܬܐ ܘܒܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܡܫܬܘܕܥܝܢ ܒܢ̈ܝܢܫܐ ܠܐܠܗܐ

msItem.title: 19. The Gospels
msItem.note: The following are cited.

msItem.author: Eusebius
msItem.title: The volume concludes with a section from the Ecclesiastical History of Eusebius, treating of the Apostles, Evangelists, and their successors, and of the calamities that befel the persecutors of our Lord
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܛܠ ܫ̈ܠܝܚܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܘܐܘ̈ܢܓܠܣܛܐ ܘܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܬܪܗܘܢ̣̇ ܘܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܒܝ̈ܫ̣ܬܐ ܣܒܠܘ ܟܐܢܐܝܬ܇ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܐܡܪܚܘ ܥܠ ܦܪܘܩܢ. ܡܢ ܐܩܠܣܝܣܛܝܩܐ ܕܐܘܣܒܝܣ

item.p: Vellum, about 12 in. by 8 5/8, consisting of 255 leaves, one of which (fol. 10) is much torn. The quires, signed with letters, were originally 27 in number, but the whole of ܐ is now lost, as well as the first leaf of ܓ. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 47 lines. This manuscript is written in a good, regular Estrangělā, of the viiith or ixth cent.
The scribe Thomas mentions his name in the concluding words:

p.quote: ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܬܐܘܡܐ ܡܚܝܠܐ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܐܝܟ ܚܝܠܗ. ܕܢܬܚ̣ܢܢ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ ܐܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: Just below Thomas' note, apparently in the same handwriting, but in a more cursive character, is written:

p.quote: ܐܢܓܢܛܝܘܣ ܠܒܝܫ ܠܐܠܗܐ. ܚܙܐ ܒܓܠܝܢܐ ܐܠܗܝܐ ܠܚܝ̈ܠܘܬܐ ܥ̈ܠܝܐ ܕܡܙܡܪ̈ܝܢ ܒܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܓܘ̈ܕܐ̣. ܘܗ̣ܘ ܐܫܠܡ ܠܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܕܗܟܢܐ ܬܙܡ̇ܪ.

item.p: A note on the same page informs us that the manuscript was collated by the deacons Abraham and Joseph:

p.quote: ܦܚ̇ܡܘ ܕܝܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܘܝܘܣܦ ܡܫ̈ܡܢܫܐ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ̣ ܕܢܬܚ̇ܢܢܘܢ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ ܐܝܟ ܓܝ̇ܣܐ ܕܡܢ ܝܡܢܝܐ̣ ܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: On fol. 255 b is a note stating that this was one of the volumes brought to the convent of S. Mary Deipara by the abbat Moses of Nisibis, A. Gr. 1243, A.D. 932.

revisionDesc.change: The Syriac copied from the Word Document needs to be checked for accuracy
